pageContext.claim: “They are using the IRS against me.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump is the first president since Richard Nixon to refuse to publicly reveal his tax returns. House Democrats point to plain language in the law that the IRS shall turns over a president's tax returns to the tax-writing committees upon request. But ultimately it will become a matter for the Supreme Court. Trump may have also been referring to a whistleblower complaint by an IRS employee alleging that a Trump administration official attempted to interfere with the mandatory audits of either Trump or Vice president Pence. But neither of these issues involves use of the IRS against Trump.
